newsitem.title: INDIA: India's BPL cellular completes $100 mln ADR issue.
newsitem.headline: India's BPL cellular completes $100 mln ADR issue.

text.p: BPL Cellular Holdings Ltd (BPLCH), the cellular holding company of India's BPL Telecom Business Group, has completed a $100 million American Depositary Receipt (ADR) issue, company officials said on Wednesday.
Each ADR, representing one share, was placed at $7.50, a corporate finance BPL official in Bangalore told Reuters.
BPLCH's fully paid up capital, following the ADR, will be 569.8 million rupees, K. Ravi Shankar, vice president corporate finance for the group, told Reuters.
The ADR, after dilution, will account for 23.4 percent of the fully paid up capital, he said.

"This successful offering marks the first such offering after the government of India recently announced incentives in the areas of infrastructure and telecommunications," Shankar said in a statement released earlier.
The company withdrew plans to offer a $200 million ADR issue in December after its then lead manager Morgan Stanley advised there were too many uncertainites in the Indian telecommunications sector.
The just concluded issue was lead managed by SSKI Finance and the group's in-house corporate finance division.
AIG Investment Corp and Asian Infrastructure Fund (AIF) were among the main investors in the issue.
BPL plans to list the ADR on the National Association of Security Dealers Automated Quotes (NASDAQ).
